plant_type: Evergreen shrub or tree to 6m; Striking fruit covered in stiff red hairs; Use as a natural food colouring
position: Full sun, moist well drained soil
sowing_method: **Raise seedlings:** This means seeds are best started off in trays or other containers and then transplanted to their final position once they are established
description: **Annatto (Bixa orellana)** is a striking evergreen tree or shrub growing to 6m, but commonly reaches around 3m in cultivation. Its glossy green leaves are pointed and heart-shaped, reaching up to 15cm long, while its pink and white flowers form clusters that stand out against the foliage. The fruit is covered in stiff bright red hairs and splits open when ripe to reveal dark red seeds covered in edible orange pulp. These seeds can be used to create a flavorless food coloring similar to turmeric, known as annato or lipstick tree.
additional_information: Pink/Rose Flowers; Container growing; Cut flowers; Culinary use
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

description: **Jelly Melon (Cucumis melo)** is a climbing vine native to Africa that produces unique green thorned fruit which mature into a bright orange/yellow color. The fruit can be enjoyed at any stage, but the mature variety has the best flavor - its jelly-like flesh tastes like a mix of banana, lime, and cucumber. Jelly Melon is commonly eaten fresh or used as a garnish; it stores well and makes an attractive decoration.

description: **Banana Shallot**, also known as French Echalions, is a cross between an onion and a shallot. The elongated bulbs with pointed ends are the largest of any shallot, with a smooth skin that's easy to peel. The firm white flesh has a milder and more subtle taste than onion and can be used raw or cooked in sauces, meat dishes, and soups.

The roots have a black skin and white flesh, with young shoots and flower buds also being edible. They can be harvested in the first year or when more mature in their second year. description: **Mung Bean**: This perennial tropical climbing vine (grown as an annual in cool climates) can reach heights of up to 200cm. Native to Asia, it's prized for its vibrant blue and white flowers, which have a rich history of medicinal uses. The flowers are not only edible but also versatile - they can be consumed fresh, dried, or powdered, making them perfect for brewing a distinctive blue-colored tea. When used as a natural food coloring, the flowers change color with pH levels, shifting from blue to pink when lemon juice is added. Mung Bean leaves serve as a nutritious stock feed, while its roots have nitrogen-fixing properties, making it an excellent cover crop.
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

The beautiful mauve flowers are a delight to behold! Expect to get around 15 years of production from these plants, even in cooler climates. The fruit is a stunning rounded apple shape, 4cm long, with thick walls and juicy pulp. As it ripens, the colour changes from yellow to orange, with small black seeds inside. Enjoy the intense heat and light capsicum flavour, perfect for making hot sauces and spicy salsas.

description: **Molokhia (Jute Mallow)**: This ancient Egyptian plant boasts nutritious green leaves used as a vegetable in Middle Eastern cuisine. Older leaves can be cooked like spinach and added to stews and soups, releasing a jelly-like slimy substance that serves as a natural thickener. Young leaves are perfect for fresh salads, while the stems of this versatile plant are used to produce Jute, often grown as a commercial fibre crop.

It can be consumed raw or cooked, making it an excellent addition to salads, sauces, stir-fries, and fish, poultry, or egg dishes.

The tops of the green leaves can also be consumed like spring onions.

description: **Perennial Onion**, also known as a "Multiplier" or "Underground Onion", grows to 40cm tall and produces clumps of 10-12 bulbs under the soil's surface. This Australian heirloom variety from the late 1800s can be left in the ground to reproduce, making it easy to lift, save, and replant the bulbs year after year. The bulbs are small, with a flavor somewhere between onions and milder shallots, and can be used as a substitute for shallots or roasted and caramelized. The tops of the green leaves can also be eaten like a spring onion, leaving at least half the height to provide energy for the bulbs to grow. Bulbs store for 6-8 months.

plant_type: Perennial to 100cm; Long green stalks tinged with crimson; Very productive
position: Full or part sun, moist well drained soil
characteristics: Sweet and sour flavour; Mild flavour
description: **Rhubarb** ('Large Victorian', 'Victorian Giant') A highly productive perennial growing to 100cm with long green stalks tinged with crimson, introduced in 1837 and named for Queen Victoria. This robust and very productive variety is low maintenance. The large stalks have a sweet flavour, while the palmate leaves contain *oxalic acid* and should not be eaten by humans or animals; they can even be used to make a garden insecticide. Rhubarb crowns are rhizomes (or underground runners) from parent plants that establish new growth, making them an ideal choice for home gardeners who want a head start on establishing their plants.

description: **Runner Beans** are a distinct species from common (French) beans, boasting unique characteristics. This frost-tender perennial is usually grown as an annual. Its attractive, fast-growing vine boasts lush green foliage and vibrant scarlet red flowers. The plant produces an abundance of long, flat, green beans that can grow up to 20cm in length. These tender shoots can be enjoyed raw when young and sweet, cooked like common beans when larger, or left to mature as a dried bean. Young beans have a delectable sweetness and richness that's hard to resist. With its fast growth rate and heavy cropping, this plant is often grown for its ornamental value in cooler climates. It's also known as **Seven Year Bean**, **Scarlet Runner Beans**, and **Multiflora Bean**.

plant_type: Deciduous shrub to 250cm; Edible orange fruit in autumn and winter; Tolerates coastal conditions
position: Full sun, well drained soil
sowing_method: **Raise seedlings:** This means seeds are best started off in trays or other containers and then transplanted to their final position once they are established

description: **Sea Berry**, also known as 'Siberian Pineapple' and 'Sha-ji', is a deciduous shrub or small tree that grows up to 250cm with thorny stems and branches, featuring willow-like silver green leaves. Female plants produce insignificant yellow flowers followed by edible orange fruit that remains on the branches through winter. The thin-skinned fruit has a sour taste but can be sweetened for use in jams, jellies, sauces, or tea, and even juiced. Rich in vitamins A, C, and E, this plant is suitable for permaculture gardens as it fixes nitrogen in the soil and provides shelter for birds. It tolerates poor soil and coastal conditions, making it ideal for cold climates.
additional_information: Yellow Flowers; Culinary use; Ornamental use

position: Full sun, well drained soil

description: **Banana Shallot** is a biennial echalion, traditionally grown as an annual, with tapered bulbs featuring reddish-brown skin. Its mild flavor makes it perfect for use in dressings, sauces, soups, and stews, either cooked or raw. The green leaves can be enjoyed like spring onions, leaving half the leaf intact to promote bulb growth. As a cross between onions and true shallots, echalions are known as **Echalions** or **Echalots**. This long-day variety thrives in cold climates, maturing late in the season.

description: **Fig Leaf Gourd**, also known by its various aliases such as 'zambo', 'chilacayote', 'black-seed squash', 'alcoyta', and 'Malabar gourd', is a prolific vine originating from South America. It thrives in warm climates (or can be grown as an annual in cold climates) with green leaves resembling those of a fig. Each vine produces numerous fruit, roughly the size of a watermelon, featuring green and white striped skin. The tender flesh has a neutral flavor and is often used in soups, stews, stir-fries, or as a substitute for zucchini. The seeds can be roasted and enjoyed like pepitas.

Its vigorous vines produce pale green skin with creamy white flesh, growing up to 1 meter in length. When picked young, it has a flavor similar to zucchini and can be sautéed, grilled, or pickled. As it matures, the fruit can be roasted or used in soups.

description: **Kamo Kamo (Maori Squash)**: This versatile and productive squash is a staple crop for New Zealand's Maori people. The round, ribbed fruit grows on a vigorous vine and can be harvested when small and green, with a flavor similar to zucchini. It can also be left to mature, at which point the skin turns orange-green and hardens, and the flesh has a mild taste similar to butternut pumpkin.

description: **Zucchini Tromboncino (Serpentine Squash)**: This climbing vine produces long pale green zucchini-like fruit with a bulbous end. The fruit is used like a zucchini and has a comparable flavor and tender texture, best when picked at around 25cm long. Fruits can also be left to mature and will harden, making them suitable for use like a pumpkin. This variety boasts good disease resistance and high yields.

plant_type: Evergreen tree to 7m; Edible fruit; Ornamental bark and flowers
position: Full or part sun, moist well drained soil
sowing_method: **Raise seedlings:** This means seeds are best started off in trays or other containers and then transplanted to their final position once they are established
description: **Arbutus unedo (Irish Strawberry Tree)**: This evergreen shrub or small tree grows up to 7m tall with a rounded canopy. Its dark green leaves and ornamental stringy cinnamon-colored bark make it an attractive feature tree, while clusters of dainty white bell-shaped flowers bloom in autumn and winter. The edible fruit turns from green to orange and then bright red when ripe, with a sweet-tart and tropical flavor reminiscent of mango, apricot, peach, and guava.
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

description: **Fragaria vesca (Wild Strawberry)**: This perennial grows up to 15cm tall and is also known as "Wild Strawberry" or "Woodland Strawberry". Its attractive bright green leaves make it suitable for borders, beds, window boxes, containers, hanging baskets, and rockeries. Strawberries are grown for their small to medium-sized red fruit, making this plant a great ornamental choice.

description: . **Sugar Ann (Climbing Sugar Snap Pea)**: This climbing sugar snap pea grows up to 100cm tall and is best grown on a trellis but can also thrive as a bush on the ground. Its very sweet, thick-walled green pods are around 8cm long with excellent flavor for eating raw, steaming, or frying. With good yields, this home garden variety is perfect for adding to salads and stir-fries. Note: This variety contains approximately 2-4% seeds that will produce off-type regular pea plants.

plant_type: Heirloom patty pan squash; Unusually shaped fruit; Highly productive bushes
position: Full sun, moist well drained soil
description: **Gatersleben Patty Pan Squash**: Hailing from Germany and thriving in cool climates, this heirloom variety is perfect for small gardens and containers. Its compact bushes are incredibly productive, providing a continuous supply of delicious fruit if harvested regularly. The lemon-yellow maturing to orange fruit has a flattened top, reminiscent of a beret or muffin top, and its tender flesh boasts a sweet flavor when picked young (no more than 10cm across). Enjoy it raw, roasted, grilled, or sautéed - the possibilities are endless!

Enjoy the young leaves cooked as a spinach substitute - they're firm and sweet.

Even the flowers can be enjoyed raw or added to salads, thanks to their delicate evening scent.

plant_type: Shrubby perennial 2-2.5m tall; Bicolour orange to pink fruits have red shoulders; Very sweet, slightly tangy taste
position: Full sun, moist well-drained soil
sowing_method: Tamarillo- Bicolor seeds can be sown directly into the garden OR seedlings can be raised in trays or other containers and transplanted to the garden once established
characteristics: Shrubby perennial 2-2.5m tall; Very sweet, slightly tangy taste; Flavour is oyster-like; Excellent flavour
description: **Tree Tomato** (_Cyphomandra betacea_): This shrubby perennial boasts an upright woody stem, large green leaves, and a shallow root system, growing up to 2-2.5m tall. Its bicolour orange to pink egg-shaped fruits have red shoulders and are produced in clusters. The flesh is very sweet and slightly tangy, with a taste similar to a cross between passion fruit and tomato. Enjoy it raw or cooked, as a stewed fruit or turned into jams and chutneys! It prefers regular watering, free draining soil, full sun, and protection from wind. Prune after winter for optimal growth.
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

plant_type: Perennial to 200cm; Also known as Tree Tomato
position: Full sun, moist well drained soil
description: **Tree Tomato** (_Cyphomandra betacea_): This perennial shrub grows up to 200cm tall, producing large green leaves and shallow roots. Its red egg-shaped fruits are produced in clusters on stems and can be eaten raw or cooked. The tangy flesh is perfect as a stewed fruit or turned into jams and condiments. Originating from South America, the red variety was developed in New Zealand. For best results, provide regular watering, free draining soil, full sun, and protection from wind. Prune after winter to promote new growth.
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

position: Part or full sun, moist well drained soil
sowing_method: **Sow direct:** This means that the seeds are best sown directly into the garden
hardiness_life_cycle: Hardy Biennial (usually grown as an annual)
description: **Hidabeni Red F1 Turnip**: Add some excitement to your garden with the vibrant Hidabeni Red F1 turnips! These fast-growing vegetables have scarlet skin and pink-streaked white flesh, making them a colorful addition to salads, pickles, or cooked dishes. Both the root and leaves are edible, so you can enjoy this versatile crop in various ways. For best results, plant in well-drained fertile soil with full sun and expect it to mature within 50 days.

plant_type: Succulent perennial to 50cm; Medicinal uses; Suited to containers
position: Full or part sun, moist well drained soil
characteristics: Best flavour of the common thyme varieties; Refreshing flavour
description: . **Aloe Vera** is a succulent, clump-forming perennial growing to 50cm with thick, fleshy mid-green upright leaves sometimes marked with white spots or stripes, featuring a line of soft thorns along each edge. The plants produce flower spikes with clusters of small orange flowers that attract honey-eating birds; they rarely bloom indoors. Aloe vera leaves contain a gel used medicinally to treat sunburn and other skin irritations, and the flesh can be cut and added to smoothies or other drinks. It's suited for growing in garden beds or containers in bright filtered light indoors or full/part sun outdoors, and is drought-tolerant.
additional_information: Orange Flowers; Container growing; Drought tolerant; Culinary use; Medicinal use; Ornamental use

position: Full or part sun, moist well drained soil
characteristics: Glossy sweet fruit; Very tender with exceptional flavour; Tender flesh; High yielding
description: . **Thornless Blackberry**: A perennial fruiting plant that produces large, glossy black berries from December to March on long, nearly thornless canes. Not only high-yielding but also suitable for all climates with a cold winter, Thornless Blackberries are complex hybrids derived from several Rubus species and offer an advantage over traditional European Blackberries in not becoming weeds in Australian environments. The berry canes themselves are the roots and stems grown for one year then pruned, dug up, and sold bare-rooted without soil, making them an excellent choice for gardeners looking to grow this fruit.

description: **Carolina Reaper**: Perennial (usually grown as an annual in cool climates) growing to 120cm. The 5cm long chillies hang from the bush and are red and wrinkled, some with a sharp point at the tip that is said to resemble a scorpion's tail. The flavour is fruity followed by an extreme level of heat; This variety held the Guinness Book of Records title as the world's hottest chilli from 2011 to 2013, with heat measuring 1,463,700 SHU on the _Scoville scale_.

position: Full sun, moist soil
sowing_method: **Sow direct:** This means that the seeds are best sown directly into the garden
description: **Japanese Striped Corn**: This open-pollinated variety from Japan boasts **striped pink, white, and green leaves** that add a pop of color to the veggie garden. Plants grow 150-180cm tall, and the striking leaf stripes appear once they reach about 30cm in height. Expect a small percentage of plants to have solid green leaves, but don't worry – it's just part of their charm! Harvest dark burgundy kernels on small cobs for a richly colored cornmeal.
additional_information: Drought tolerant; Culinary use; Ornamental use
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

plant_type: Climbing perennial cactus; Hot pink flowers and purple fleshed fruit; Requires cross-pollination
position: Full or part sun, well drained soil
characteristics: Sour cherry flavour; Sweet, mild flavour; Mild onion flavour
description: **Red Jade Dragon Fruit** Synonyms: _Selenicereus hybrid_; This striking hot pink flowered, climbing cactus has red skin with green fins and purple flesh with a sweet berry flavour. Self-sterile, requiring cross pollination with another variety; native to Guatemala. The cactus-like plants are succulent and grow up a pole or trellis, with multiple spreading branches at the top. Tropical flowers that resemble waterlilies open at night and are pollinated by bats or moths. Also known as 'Pitaya', ''Pitahya', 'Queen of the Night', 'Night-blooming Cactus', 'Moonlight Cactus' and 'Cinderella Plant'. Bare-rooted cuttings are between 15cm and 25cm in length. ![Red Jade dragon fruit cuttings](https://www.theseedcollection.com.au/assets/images/Untitled%20design%202023-10-16T130944_159.jpg)
additional_information: Pink/Rose Flowers; Container growing; Drought tolerant; Culinary use

plant_type: Climbing perennial cactus; Red fruit with red skin; Requires cross-pollination
position: Full or part sun, well drained soil
characteristics: Pale-pink/white flowers with sweet scent; Fast-growing shrub or small tree; Sweet, mild flavour; Mild onion flavour
description: **White Giant Dragon Fruit** Synonyms: _Hylocereus megalanthus_; This succulent perennial cactus grows as a climbing vine with large, white flowers that bloom at night. The fruit has red skin and red flesh with a sweet flavour and slight tartness. Self-sterile, requiring cross pollination with another variety; native to Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador and neighbouring countries. The cactus-like plants are succulent and grow up a pole or trellis, with multiple spreading branches at the top. Tropical flowers that resemble waterlilies open at night and are pollinated by bats or moths. Also known as 'Pitaya', ''Pitahya', 'Queen of the Night', 'Night-blooming Cactus', 'Moonlight Cactus' and 'Cinderella Plant'. Bare-rooted cuttings are between 15cm and 25cm in length. ![Yellow 68 dragon fruit cuttings](https://www.theseedcollection.com.au/assets/images/Untitled%20design%202023-10-16T131154_593.jpg)

plant_type: Climbing perennial cactus; Yellow fruit with white flesh; Sweet with excellent flavour
position: Full or part sun, well drained soil
characteristics: Sweet with excellent flavour; Sweet, mild flavour; Mild onion flavour; Sweet flavour; Sweet-tart translucent white berries
description: **Colombian Yellow Dragon Fruit** Synonyms: _Hylocereus megalanthus_; This succulent perennial cactus grows as a climbing vine with large, white scented flowers and fruit with yellow skin and white flesh. One of the sweetest varieties with excellent flavour; self-pollinating; native to Colombia, Ecuador and Peru. The cactus-like plants are succulent and grow up a pole or trellis, with multiple spreading branches at the top. Tropical flowers that resemble waterlilies open at night and are pollinated by bats or moths. Also known as 'Pitaya', 'Pitahya', 'Queen of the Night', 'Night-blooming Cactus', 'Moonlight Cactus' and 'Cinderella Plant'. Bare-rooted cuttings are between 15cm and 25cm in length. ![Yellow megalanthus dragon fruit cuttings](https://www.theseedcollection.com.au/assets/images/Untitled%20design%202023-10-16T125422_411.jpg)
additional_information: White/Cream Flowers; Container growing; Drought tolerant; Culinary use

position: Full or part sun, well drained soil

description: **Zamorano Dragon Fruit** Synonyms: _Hylocereus polyrhizus_; This succulent perennial cactus grows as a climbing vine with yellow to white night-blooming flowers and medium sized, rounded fruit. The fruit has pink/red skin and dark pink flesh with a mild, sweet flavour; self-pollinating but will produce larger crops when planted with another variety. Native to Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador and neighbouring countries. The cactus-like plants are succulent and grow up a pole or trellis, with multiple spreading branches at the top. Tropical flowers that resemble waterlilies open at night and are pollinated by bats or moths. Also known as 'Pitaya', ''Pitahya', 'Queen of the Night', 'Night-blooming Cactus', 'Moonlight Cactus' and 'Cinderella Plant'. Bare-rooted cuttings are between 15cm and 25cm in length. ![Zamorano dragon fruit cuttings](https://www.theseedcollection.com.au/assets/images/Untitled%20design%202023-10-16T125912_461.jpg)

description: **Elephant Garlic** Closely related to leek, this garlic variety produces very large bulbs up to 15cm in diameter with white skin and 2-5 cloves each. Cloves are large with tan skin and a mild flavour between true garlic and leek; suitable for roasting or slicing into salads. Plants have broad blue-green leaves with a central rib and tall flower stalks topped by large spheres of pink or purple flowers in summer. Also known as 'Russian Garlic'. Plant cloves Autumn and Spring (cold climates), Autumn, Winter and Spring (subtropical and tropical zones). Harvest after flowers begin to dry.

It offers a pungent and robust flavor with hints of sweetness, prized for its culinary versatility. This variety thrives in cold climates and produces 4-5 large, easy-to-peel cloves per bulb. Plants are tall with upright, vibrant green leaves and scapes that coil in various ways. **Hardneck - Porcelain** type.

plant_type: Nearly thornless canes; Yellow/green berries are sweet when they turn red; Vigorous grower with good disease resistance
position: Full or part sun, moist well drained soil
characteristics: Yellow/green berries are sweet when they turn red; Sweet, juicy golden yellow fruit; Mild ginger flavour
description: . **Pax**: A strong-growing, cold-hardy variety with nearly thornless canes growing approximately 1-1.5m x 1-1.5m. Its pink flowers are self-fertile and produce yellow-green berries that ripen to sweet-tart red fruit from early to mid-summer. The ripe red berries are delicious eaten fresh or in desserts, while the slightly unripe pink fruit can be cooked and made into jam, pie fillings, or sauces. This variety is a cross introduced in 1949 that captures the best traits of both European and American gooseberries.

description: **Calabash Gourd**: This fast-growing climbing vine produces small, bottle-shaped green gourds up to 15cm in length. The fruit can be harvested when green and cooked, often used in curry dishes. If left to dry on the vine, the gourds will ripen to an orange color, developing a thicker, pumpkin-like skin with a hollow interior. Historically, dried calabash gourds have been used as vessels or even musical instruments. This variety is popular for craft uses and decorations.

description: . **Japanese Parsley**: Delight your senses with the evergreen perennial that's commonly grown as an annual! Its compact growth resembles Italian parsley, with leaves boasting a mouth-watering aroma and flavour that combines celery and parsley notes. Use as a garnish or add it to salads, stir-fries, soups, stews, rice dishes – even sushi! Also known by names like **Japanese Parsley**, **Trefoil**, and **Honeywort**.
additional_information: Container growing; Culinary use; Medicinal use

plant_type: Very fast-growing tree; Best grown in warm climates; Seeds contain high-quality oil
position: Full sun, moist well-drained soil
season: Spring and early summer (any time in tropical climates)
characteristics: Very fast-growing tree; Flavour is oyster-like; Heat tolerant and disease resistant
description: **Moringa oleifera**: This fast-growing, drought-tolerant tree can reach heights of up to 10m tall. Its creamy white flowers produce long pods containing numerous seeds, which are a rich source of high-quality oil. Known as the Drumstick Tree or Miracle Tree, moringa is valued for its versatility: it's used in herbal medicine, as fodder for animals, and as fuel wood and fertilizer. With annual pruning, you can encourage branching and control its height. In warmer climates, moringa remains evergreen to semi-evergreen, but in cooler climates, it sheds leaves.
additional_information: Drought tolerant; Culinary use; Medicinal use; Other use

description: **Husk Tomato** (synonyms: _Physalis philadelphica Lam_) is an annual from Mexico that grows up to 120cm tall. This plant produces delicious green/purple fruit encased in a papery husk called a calyx. The calyx becomes brittle and begins to split when the fruit is ready for harvest, but be warned: it's not edible! Enjoy your Husk Tomatoes raw or cooked - they're perfect for salsas, sauces, jams, preserves, curries, soups, and stews.
seed_type: Open pollinated, untreated, non-GMO variety of seed

plant_type: Biennial to 60cm; Easy to grow; Edible leaves, bulbils and bulbs
position: Full sun, well drained soil

description: **Tree Onion**, also known as *Allium cepa*, is an easy-to-grow, clump-forming biennial that reaches 60cm in height. Its long, hollow leaves resemble those of a bunching onion, and mature plants produce miniature bulbs called bulbils at the top of the flower stems. These bulbils can form roots where they touch the ground, giving the appearance of the plant 'walking' across the garden over time. At maturity, the plants yield bulbs approximately 4cm in diameter at the base of the stems, with 6 to 10 bulbs produced per stem. The leaves, bulbils, and bulbs are all edible and have a mild onion flavor, making them a versatile addition to various dishes.

description: **Youngberry** (Rubus spp. hybrid) This unique berry was developed in 1905 by B.M. Young in Louisiana, USA. A hybrid of blackberry, raspberry, and dewberry, youngberries have roundish fruits carried on long canes that ripen to a deep purple-black color in summer. Sweet-tart flavor makes them perfect for fresh eating or using in jams, pies, and preserves.

description: **Costata Romanesca** (Cucurbita pepo) This Italian heirloom variety boasts semi-vining plants producing large ribbed green/grey zucchinis with flecked skin. Excellent nutty flavor and firm flesh make it great for all-purpose use. Quick growth rate and abundance of fruit are just a few benefits of growing this popular variety.
